channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nasdaq Leads Indexes Higher
item.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq snapped five-day losing streaks, led higher by tech and chip stocks. The Dow Industrials also advanced.

item.title: Darden Restaurants stock climbs as Olive Garden, LongHorn Steakhouse fuel sales growth
item.description: Darden Restaurants met Wall Street's expectations for its fiscal second-quarter results.

item.title: The Score: Boeing, Tesla, U.S. Steel and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Falls 0.2% To 102.99
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index was down 0.2% to 102.99 — snapping a three-trading-day winning streak.

item.title: Nike CEO Elliott Hill outlines new strategy after retailer blames promotions for declining revenue and profit
item.description: Nike beat Wall Street's expectations on the top and bottom lines under new CEO Elliott Hill.

item.title: Rivian stock has its best day ever after EV maker reports 2024 production, deliveries
item.description: Rivian on Friday said it produced 49,476 electric vehicles last year.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Sink on Weather Shift, Storage Miss
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures retreated as near-term temperatures weren’t seen as cold as previously forecast, while last week’s inventory draw of 116 Bcf ...

item.title: Tesla reports first-ever drop in annual deliveries
item.description: Tesla's fourth-quarter deliveries report follows a huge late-year rally in the stock that lifted its gain for 2024 to 63%.

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on the U.S. housing market, Partners Group and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Micron shares plunge on weak second-quarter guidance
item.description: Micron shares plunged in extended trading after the chipmaker issued weaker-than-expected second-quarter guidance.
